title: MUSIC GEN_MUS 175-0-21 Selected Topics in Music Literature for Non-Majors

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will incorporate a study of dance and music as they have evolved in western classical repertoire, with an emphasis on collaborative processes and creations. Genres to be studied include romantic, classical, and twentieth-century ballet, modern dance and its evolution, as well as jazz dance, tap dance, folk dance, ballroom, and dance for musical theatre. Students will be exposed to prominent choreographers and composers and will learn the vocabulary and the tools for critical analysis employed in the discussion and appreciation of dance and the music associated with it. Class will incorporate on-line and live performance viewings, a listening/watching journal, in-class presentations, participation, and a final project.
